instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Hi.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board that doesn't seem to have any liquid damage. This computer (on battery only) turns on and boots, but only will stay on for about a minute before it crashes. I have tried multiple batteries.

The same computer will turn on and boot and STAY on if it plugged into charger.

PPBUS while on battery stays steady 7.95V during and after the crash.

Thanks!


ALSO - I think customer using chinese charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message: Tried a for sure known good battery from a working machine? Could be a current sensing issue or even a charge fet issue. If for sure tried working battery, check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Does it recognize and charge the battery?
Try known good battery, even old.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Thanks for the reponses.

Recognizes and charges battery

I have tried 3 different batteries.

1 new and two from a 2015 Macbook Air

pins 17/18 - 3 Ohm

pins 27/28- 20 Ohm

Changed ISL.

Reflowed SMC just in case there was some liquid from humidity or something

Same result.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
This happens only starting on battery alone?
Still same thing if you start with charger + battery and remove the charger?
After crash, battery percentage (reported by OSX) is the same, or dropped a lot?
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> has correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
This happens when only starting battery alone. 

I have had it plugged in next to me for a while listen to youtube ( Battery and Charger)

I just unplugged it from the charger and it crashed within 30 Secs. 

Battery was fully charged when it crashed and still is fully charged in OS X.

<RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> - 5 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message: Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Did you start in SMC bypass with charger and battery?
Remove charger after starts and see if turns off again on battery only.
Fan should start at maxim; if not, you are not in SMC bypass...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Ok well you got it!

Computer going for five minutes and still going
on battery in SMC Bypass.


You think china charger F'd this up?

reball or replace?


Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Run ASD on charger + battery.
Set On Error to Continue and uncheck HDD and memory test.
Should be some SMC sensor error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crash issues.
threads.message:
Hi. 

I had gone ahead and replaced the SMC before I saw your reply. Everything seems good now!

Thanks for your time!
